page.title: 03SALMESTONE GRANGE
page.content: SALMESTONE WAS RECORDED IN THE ORIGINAL DOOMSDAY BOOK.THE LAND BELONGED TO AND WAS FARMED BY MONKS. THEY GREW GRAIN,BRED DOVES TO EAT AND BUILT A CHAPEL,DORMITORY,REFECTORY AND CLOISTERS.THE BUILDINGS NOW BELONG TO WILLIAM WHEELAN.THE CHAPEL IS USED WEEKLY FOR A ROMAN CATHOLIC SERVICE FOR THE CHILDREN OF ST.GREGORY'S SCHOOL.THE REFECTORY IS USED AS A DINING ROOM FOR THE CHILDREN.THE OLD GRANARY IS NOW THE GRANGE;THIS IS A HOUSE DIVIDED INTO 3 APARTMENTS.YOUNG PEOPLE ON Y.T.S.SCHEMES ARE HELPING TO RESTORE THE BUILDINGS AND TIDY THE GROUNDS.IT WILL OPEN TO THE PUBLIC AS A TOURIST ATTRACTION IN SUMMER AS IT IS THE OLDEST HOUSE IN MARGATE.
